=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
Here’s an overview of what’s going on in the game:

• Genre and Feel:
 – It’s essentially an action–adventure puzzle game with arcade elements. You’re navigating a maze-like level, avoiding or fighting enemies, collecting items, and reaching an objective.
 – The game mixes puzzle-solving (figuring out the safe path and item collection) with real‑time action (dodging or shooting enemies).

• Key Mechanics:
 1. Movement and Shooting:
  • You control an avatar that can shoot using a sword attack. The avatar has a defined “shoot” behavior (frameRate=8) so timing and aiming are part of the gameplay.
 2. Items and Transformations:
  • You must collect a key (represented by the “key” sprite). The key is essential for unlocking the door—the “goal”—that leads to victory.
  • When an unkeyed character (shown as “nokey”) touches the key, it transforms into the “withkey” version. This indicates you’re now carrying the key.
 3. Enemies and Combat:
  • Various enemies (including “monsterQuick”, “monsterNormal”, “monsterSlow”, and generic “enemy”) patrol the level.
  • Your sword can be used to defeat enemies (interaction: enemy + sword kills the enemy and scores points). However, you must avoid direct contact with enemies as colliding with them causes a penalty or even kills the avatar.
 4. Goal Interaction:
  • The door (“goal”) only reacts correctly when you approach it as the “withkey” version; otherwise, if you’re in the “nokey” state, the door pushes you back.
  • Reaching the goal as “withkey” effectively wins the level.

• Objective and Win/Loss Conditions:
 – Objective: Navigate the level, overcome obstacles, collect the key to transform your avatar into its “withkey” state, and then reach the goal door to complete the level.
 – Win Condition: The game ends successfully when you interact with the goal (door) while in the correct state (with the key).
 – Loss Condition: The game is lost if your avatar is killed (for example, by coming into contact with enemies without using your sword attack properly).

• Overall Strategy:
 1. Early in the level, focus on staying safe by dodging enemies and planning your route through the maze of walls and obstacles.
 2. Prioritize collecting the key safely. Since transforming to “withkey” is essential for opening the goal door, find a secure path to the key while minimizing risky encounters.
 3. Use your sword attack to eliminate any enemies that get too close. The ability to “shoot” with your sword means you can keep dangerous foes at bay.
 4. Once you have the key (and your avatar is now “withkey”), plot a course towards the goal door. Since the door only works when you’re carrying the key, avoiding unnecessary fighting or distractions is wise at this point.
 5. Throughout, observe the enemy patterns (the different monsters have varying speeds and cooldowns) and adjust your moves accordingly; patience and cautious advancement are key.

In simple terms, you need to navigate a labyrinth: pick up the key, fend off or avoid monsters using your sword, and then make your way to the door to finish the level. Managing risk and timing your actions (both shooting and moving) are crucial for success.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game.
